text: Henrik Johan Ibsen (born 20 March 1828 â€“ 23 May 1906) was a Norwegian realist playwright. He is often called the "father of modern drama." Ibsen is held to be the greatest of Norwegian authors and one of the most important playwrights of all time, celebrated as a national symbol by Norwegians. His greatest works can be said to be "A Doll's House" or "Enemy of the People." == References == Category:1828 births Category:1906 deaths Category:Norwegian playwrights
title: Henrik Ibsen
